page.title: 10Shoemaking in Kingswood.
page.content: {Shoemaking}is a traditional {industry} associated with Kingswood. Some families have provided generations of workers, and they originally settled here in order to be near the factory. It takes four years to train as a { {clicker}to cut the shape of the shoe out of leather. Twenty-four years ago there were 107 clickers at the shoe factory producing one hundred thousand pairs of shoes each week. The shoe industry has declined for now there are only eight clickers and thirty five thousand pairs of shoes are produced each week, mainly by machine. G.B.Brittons now produce a range of footwear including men's casual shoes and steel toe capped working boots. The factory has a{social club}for the use of employees, and their families can make use of the sports facilities. { }
